subject: Technology
title: The Mars Rovers
description: A fast breakdown of The Mars Rovers for builders.

hook.text: There are robots driving on Mars right now. They move slowly, take photos, and drill into rocks.

buildup.text: The first rover, Sojourner, landed in 1997. It was the size of a microwave and lasted 83 days.

discovery.text: Opportunity was designed for 90 days. It lasted 15 years, traveling 28 miles across the Martian surface.

twist.text: A dust storm killed Opportunity in 2018. Its last message translated to 'My battery is low and it's getting dark.'

climax.text: Perseverance landed in 2021 and is now searching for signs of ancient microbial life.

punchline.text: Robots are exploring Mars so humans know where to go next.

quiz.question: How long did the Opportunity rover last on Mars?
